quesArr.questions: What should you do when receiving an email asking for your login credentials?

answerChoices.choice: Reply to the email with your information
Send the email to other people as a warning
Reply back to the email with fake information to test it
Report the email and block it as spam

quesArr.questions: Why is it a bad practice to use the same password for multiple applications?

answerChoices.choice: If one of the applications credentials get compromised then all the other accounts are at risk
It can be easier to remember for the user
This will give the chance of forgetting the password and loosing the account
It is a common practice to have a very easy password for all of your accounts

quesArr.questions: What is a computer Malware?

answerChoices.choice: A hardware feature used to help with optimization
A network attack which locks the computer from the user
A software that harms and steals data from the users computers

quesArr.questions: What is Phishing?

answerChoices.choice: A message or an email that is built to steal important information of the user?
A program used to crash computers
A network attack which locks the computer from the user

quesArr.questions: How will users having stronger passwords improve the overall cybersecurity?

answerChoices.choice: Gives a very professional look to the hackers
They can prevent viruses from accessing control over the computer
It decreases the chances of having an account breached
Showing the attackers that longer passwords dont exactly mean harder passwords.

quesArr.questions: What is the general idea of cybersecurity?

answerChoices.choice: A programming language that codes cybersecurity patches
Cleaning out viruses with anti-virus softwares
Making sure that the workplace is safe from workplace cyber attacks
Protecting the security of computers, networks, and data from attackers

quesArr.questions: What is not a type of security threat?
What is the main reason of why cybersecurity is important?

answerChoices.choice: because it creates a safer use of the computers on the internet
because it protects the personal and important data of individuals
because it closes vulnerabilities for attackers to enter

quesArr.questions: What word best describes, safeguarding sensitive information from being stolen?
What word best describes, ensuring private communications and information to remain confidential?
What word best describes, defending the critical infrastructure and government systems?
What word best describes, protecting valuable intellect property like financial records?
What type of threat is this, Deceptive emails, messages, or websites that tricks users into sensitive information?
What type of threat is this, Unauthorized access to sensitive information, which often leads to public exposure?
What type of threat is this, Suspicious actions which occur within an organization by employees or people?
What type of threat is this, Dangerous programs that can infect or damage computers while breaking into data?
How to avoid loosing files on your system?

answerChoices.choice: Working off of a seperate system

quesArr.questions: What are ways to reduce the chance of having viruses on your system?

answerChoices.choice: Blocking suspicious links and not opening them up

quesArr.questions: What is a DDOS attack?

answerChoices.choice: Infecting the system with a virus
Blocking access to a remote system
Overloading a system in the network with large amount of traffic
Messages and emails that are suspicous when clicking

quesArr.questions: What is the best way to stay the safest when browsing the internet?

answerChoices.choice: Going to websites that have broken url links
